title: Gilling West Walks

images.title: Philip Barker / Gilling Bridge
images.caption: Gilling Bridge. This photograph depicts the road bridge over Gilling Beck in the village of Gilling West. The picture was taken from the public footpath that runs on the east side of the beck.

images.title: Aske Hall by Colin Gregory, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Aske Hall. The hall appeared in early Ted & Ralph scenes in the The Fast Show comedy series. On open days you can tour the house and see the fine collection of 18th-century furniture, paintings and porcelain.

images.title: Oliver Dixon / Village pinfold at the northern end of Gilling West
images.caption: Village pinfold at the northern end of Gilling West. Remains of village pinfold for stray sheep and water fountain, 1897.

images.title: Antonia / View of Richmond Castle from the Beacon
images.caption: View of Richmond Castle from the Beacon

description: This attractive North Yorkshire village includes a historic high street with a number of significant buildings. Things to look out for include the Grade I listed 11th century church and the Grade II listed Gilling Lodge. For walkers there's some fine Yorkshire Dales countryside and woodland to explore. This circular walk explores the countryside to the south of the village, visiting Aske Hall and the town of Richmond. The walk starts in the village and follows footpaths and bridleways south to Aske Hall. A public footpaths runs past the Georgian House with its Capability Brown gardens. The Grade I listed building is open to the public for guided tours as part of the Heritage Open Day event in September each year. Click here for more information. You continue south past the golf course at Bend Hagg before coming into Richmond. Stroll south through the town and you will soon come to the historic Richmond Castle. The route takes you along the River Swale towards Richmond Bridge before turning north Hurgill. You then head through the countryside to Beacon Hill and Coalsgarth Edge before turning north east to Gilling Wood. You then turn east passing the edge of Hartforth Wood before returning to the village.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Back in the village head to the White Swan for some rest and refreshment. Inside there's a cosy bar area and a restaurant. Outside there's a nice courtyard garden, with fig tree and kiwi vines. You can find them on the High Street at postcode DL10 5JG.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The country and woodland trails on the route make for a fine dog walk. The White Swan mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the south east there's Ellerton Lake and Bolton-on-Swale Lake. There's some nice waterside trails, a watersports centre and a wildlife rich nature reserve to be found in this area. Near here there's also Kiplin Hall where you will find a Jacobean Manor house surrounded by beautiful parkland and gardens. For more walking ideas in the area see the Yorkshire Dales Walks page.

display_address: High Street, Gilling West, Gilling with Hartforth and Sedbury, Gilling West, North Yorkshire, York and North Yorkshire, England, DL10 5JF, United Kingdom
